description.narrative:
Violence against women is a global problem. Although hard to quantify, it is clear that it in almost all coun¬tries with high population densities, patriarchal systems, gender imbalances and a history of violent con¬flict, a significant part of the women suffer regular violence, mostly by partners or family members, often linked to sexual harassment and repressive relations. In fact, women are silent on these problems and both men and women socially legitimize it by referring to traditions, customary law and prevailing beliefs and attitudes.
The project aims to contribute to a serious reduction of the incidence of violence against women, by reaching 2.2 million of men and women in the age of 12 to 40 in Nigeria, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Afghani-stan, Cambodia, Vietnam, Egypt, Sudan,Somalia, Rwanda, Niger and Mali, and effectively changing their attitudes, inducing them to speak out on the issue and take action.In order to achieve this, the project aims to build and improve the capacity in 24 leading women’s empowerment NGOs and 8 women’s empowerment alliances to stage good and effective campaigns against VaW challenging existing norms, beliefs and attitudes. They will gain the potential to scale up their reach and impact.
These partners are exposed to the systematization of the edutainment work ofthree leading subject matter specialist organizations (Soul City, Breakthrough and Puntos de Encuentro) and go through exten¬sive capacity building, including training, mentoring and coaching, but above all in practice implementation of all the steps that are at play when designing, implementing and running edutainment programs. They are also helped to actually stage campaigns (two major onesin Nigeria and Bangla¬desh and ten small-scale zero-budget assignments in the other 10 countries) and systematize them in terms of relevance, reach and impact. They are also linked to a thriving community of practice and intensively link up with the women’s movement, with production companies, media houses, broadcasting companies and cell phone and internet providers. They apply this newly acquired competence also to plan major campaigns and mobilize resources and co-investments for these.
The Somalia Office will providesupport in following up on delivery of project activities, quality assurance of reports and advice on questions raised by the partners, NAGAAD and SONYO.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.
